page.title: 17LISTED HOUSES, HOCKLIFFE
page.content: The area has several houses of {historic}and{architectural}interest. The mainly{'Queen Anne' Lodge}has been extended by the present owner. Inside the differing floor levels indicate different building periods. The pump still remains and was last used in the {1930s.} In the scullery is a bricked up bread oven. A wealthy land owner and vicar of Hockliffe{Thomas Gilpin} began work on the{Grange}in{1500s.}The building was completed in{1742.}The Gilpin coat-of-arms,{a wild boar,}is a reminder that{William Gilpin}fought at {Bosworth.}A{13th century hospice}for the poor run by a master and brethren was closed in the 16th century with the dissolution of the monasteries. It was bought by{Dunstable Priory.} Since then it has been the{Red Lion Pub,}a farm and after{19th century} {restoration}became{Hockliffe House.}
